radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral malformation of cortical development involving the parietal and occipital lobes, and the posterior parts of the temporal lobes.
Increased frequency of habitual seizures; posterior rhythmic slowing evolved into regional spiking; new seizure type described as thrashing and kicking of limbs.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After VNS was switched off, the new seizure type ceased and the patientâ€™s habitual seizures settled down to the preimplantation baseline.
